page.title: 08FARMING
page.content: This area of East Anglia is mainly arable.There are a few sheep and some dairy herds of cows.Around Stisted most of the fields are liad to barley, wheat and maize.Further to the west oil seed rape is a major crop.Due to the smaller amounts of chemical spraying on rape the poppies have reappeared in this crop. Intensive farming has meant the dissapearance of many hegderows in the area.There are also large areas of pasture.The farms are mostly run by tenant farmers and are owned by 2 or 3 firms or individuals.Stubble burning is seen everywhere in late summer.
